description: Survey of the civilization of Japan from prehistoric times to the present.
name: INTRO TO JAPANESE CIVIL

values.comments:
This is a survey of the civilization of Japan from prehistoric times to the present. 

Students generally seemed to feel that it was “topically a fascinating course, though not the most interesting presentation.” Many noted that even though the course material was interesting, they could not get engaged in the lectures. A lot of students reported learning a lot from the course, although some expressed discontent with the material learned. For example, one student said the course focused too much on “learning about differing approaches of studying the history” rather that studying the history itself. 

Students were overall unhappy with the quality of Professor Horiguchi’s lecturing. Although many noted that he was undoubtedly “very qualified,” they also said that he needed to work on making the lectures more comprehensible. 

Students also noted that the recitation for this class was very helpful. Many also said that there was a lot of reading required for the course. This class is a requirement for the East Asian Languages and Civilizations major.
